metadata.name: Ensure that the --token-auth-file parameter is not set (Automated)
metadata.description: Do not use token based authentication.
metadata.rationale: The token-based authentication utilizes static tokens to authenticate requests to the apiserver. The tokens are stored in clear-text in a file on the apiserver, and cannot be revoked or rotated without restarting the apiserver. Hence, do not use static token-based authentication.
metadata.audit:
Run the following command on the control plane node:
```
ps -ef | grep kube-apiserver
```
Verify that the `--token-auth-file` argument does not exist.
metadata.remediation:
Follow the documentation and configure alternate mechanisms for
authentication. Then,
edit the API server pod specification file `/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-apiserver.yaml` 
on the control plane node and remove the `--token-auth-file=<filename>`
parameter.
metadata.impact: You will have to configure and use alternate authentication mechanisms such as certificates. Static token based authentication could not be used.
metadata.default_value: By default, `--token-auth-file` argument is not set.
